attributes.comment:
Increasing the fees for U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is not
reasonable.
The selection of who can become U.S. citizen should not be made through
financial burden. Even though becoming U.S. Citizen is very valuable for the
immigrant, it is also valuable for the community, economically and culturally.
Immigrants will pay their taxes and contribute to the community which will raise
the overall well being of the country.

Furthermore, increasing the fees will also affect the adoption process. Adoptive
parent have already a tremendous financial burden in finalizing the process. This
increase will prevent more families to be prospective parents. There are many
families who have everything to offer to an adoptive child, but don?t have the initial
funding to adopt.
Adoption benefit the society as the adoptive child will certainly pursue a high
education and will contribute to higher income tax. Therefore, the government
should encourage adoption instead of adding more financial charges.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Vincent Eppner
